intro: Tetrarrhena oreophila, commonly known as the mountain grass, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Tetrarrhena oreophila thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh conditions of mountainous environments. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and forage for local wildlife.
